Program Regulations for M.Sc (Clinical) Embryology\rAbout M. Sc (Clinical) Embryology Course\rThe Master of Science (M.Sc.) in (Clinical) Embryology is a specialized postgraduate program\rdesigned for individuals aiming to pursue a career in reproductive medicine and assisted\rreproductivetechnologies(ART).Thiscomprehensivecourseprovidesanin-depth\runderstanding of embryology, the branch of biology that studies the development of gametes,\rfertilization, and the development of embryos and fetuses. It combines theoretical knowledge\rwith practical training, covering subjects such as reproductive physiology, molecular genetics,\rand advanced laboratory techniques. Graduates of this program are equipped with the expertise\rto work in fertility clinics, research institutions, and academic settings, contributing to the\radvancement of reproductive health and the treatment of infertility.\rThe syllabus of the M.Sc. (Clinical) Embryology program is meticulously designed to provide a\rrobust foundation in both the theoretical and practical aspects of embryology and reproductive\rsciences. The curriculum encompasses a wide array of subjects, including reproductive anatomy\rand physiology, molecular biology, genetics, and endocrinology, all of which are essential for\runderstanding human reproduction and development. Practical modules offer hands-on training\rin advancedlaboratorytechniques such asin vitrofertilization (IVF), embryo culture,\rcryopreservation, and micromanipulation. Additionally, the program covers ethical, legal, and\rpsychosocial aspects of reproductive medicine, ensuring that students are well-prepared to\rnavigate the complexities of clinical practice. Through a blend of lectures, laboratory sessions,\rand research projects, students gain the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in the field of\rclinical embryology and contribute to innovations in assisted reproductive technologies (ART).\rYou willgain hands-on- training & practical knowledge during the entire course and will be\renriched by subject knowledge which will make you outstanding in your professional life later.\rProgram Duration and Eligibility:\rDuration4 Semesters (2 Years)\rIntake15 Seats            Unnamed: 0

Semesters (2 Years)

        15 Seats

Minimum EligibilityBachelor’s Degree (NCrF Credit Level 5.5 or equivalent) in any\rBranch of Biological Sciences, Pharmacy or Medicines (M.B.B.S.\r/ B.A.M.S. / B.H.M.S / B.D.S.)\rThe candidate who has passed eligibility exams in equivalent\rsubjects other than mentioned above need to avail eligibility\rcertificate for this programme from the Board of Equivalence\r(BoE) of Faculty of Science at the Sarvajanik University.\rTeaching, Evaluation and Other Regulations:\rAll other regulations like those for teaching and examinations for this Program are the same as\rapproved for other M.Sc. Programs by the Faculty of Science. Name of Faculty: Science         Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Program:M.Sc. Clinical Embryology          Type: Theory + Practical
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Subject: DSC-1 Cell Biology & Molecular\rTechniques With Proteomics & Metabolomics                       Semester: 1
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Credit: 04 + 02 Total Learning Hours: 60 h + 60 h
                                                                                                            Course Description:\rThe aim of this paper is to provide basic information on cell, cellular interactions and processes\ralong with insight in basic biochemical metabolisms with respect to embryo development, various\rbiophysical techniques relevant to studying metabolomics and proteomics of human embryo\rdevelopment.                               NaN
Student Learning Outcome: After completion of this course student will be able to:\r1.Understand the basic properties and functions of cell and their interactions\r2.Link major signalling pathways with in vitro embryo development\r3.Apply biophysical techniques in analysis and assessment for IVF samples.\r4.Learn the metabolomics and proteomics of embryo development for non invasive embryo\rassessment technique development.                               NaN

Name of Faculty: Science         Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Program:M.Sc. Clinical Biotechnology          Type: Theory + Practical
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Subject: DSC- 2 Human Reproductive Biology                       Semester: 1
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Credit: 04 + 02 Total Learning Hours: 60 h + 60 h
                                                                         Course Description: This Course will make students ready with all relevant backgrounds of\rhuman reproductive biology.It will provide fundamental knowledge about key concepts &\ranatomy of organs of reproduction.                               NaN
Student Learning Outcome: After completion of this course student will be\r● well informed about female & male reproductive anatomy, histology\r● will be able to understand basic concepts of gametogenesis & fertilization process\r● will be acquiring knowledge about different disorders                               NaN

Name of Faculty: Science         Department: Biotechnology
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Program:M.Sc. Clinical Biotechnology          Type: Theory + Practical
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Subject:SEC-1 Andrology Lab Techniques &\rCryobiology                       Semester: 1
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Credit: 04 + 02 Total Learning Hours: 60 h + 60 h
                                                                                                                                           Course Description: This Course will make students ready with all relevant background to deal\rmale infertility & cryopreservation of gametes. It will provide fundamental knowledge about\rsemen, sperms disorders, and cryopreservation.                               NaN
Student Learning Outcome: After completion of this course student will be\r● Well informed about semen & sperm disorders\r● Will understand the process & protocols of cryopreservation.\r● will be able to identify male factor infertility & learn techniques to manage it\r● will be skilled for sperm processing, sperm retrieval & cryopreservation of gametes\rimportant to IVF                               NaN
